meanings.sent1: The cupular flower held rainwater perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The cupular design of the vase made it ideal for holding liquids.
meanings.sent3: The cupular shape of the hat made it look like a tiny umbrella.
meanings.sent4: Her cupular earrings dangled delicately like miniature chalices.
meanings.sent5: The cupular clouds in the sky looked like fluffy bowls overhead.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a cup.
meanings.sent1: The cupular handle on the teacup was easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The cupular measurements were essential for baking the perfect cake.
meanings.sent3: The cupular ceremony involved a special toast with tea.
meanings.sent4: His cupular collection included cups from around the world.
meanings.sent5: The cupular tradition of afternoon tea was cherished by many.

meanings.sent1: The cupular hill nestled in the valley.
meanings.sent2: The cupular indentation in the sand held a tiny crab.
meanings.sent3: The cupular shadow cast by the tree looked like a giant goblet.
meanings.sent4: The cupular curve of the road led us through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The cupular top of the mushroom collected morning dew.
